Miami, FL.notes: Miami has high rent but large scholarship opportunities and stay-at-home options.

Boca Raton, FL.notes: Lower rent than Miami, strong on-campus housing support.

Gainesville, FL.notes: UF is one of the cheapest major cities for Florida college students.

Tallahassee, FL.notes: Very affordable college town with strong student housing.

Orlando, FL.notes: Many student housing communities and tech internships nearby.

Tampa, FL.notes: Growing tech hub with affordable housing options.

Coral Gables, FL.notes: Premium location near downtown Miami, high cost but excellent campus.

Atlanta, GA.notes: Vibrant tech hub with many internship opportunities.

Cambridge, MA.notes: Very expensive but world-class education and network.

Pittsburgh, PA.notes: Affordable for a major city, strong tech and robotics scene.

Berkeley, CA.notes: High cost but excellent public university with Bay Area tech access.

Seattle, WA.notes: Tech hub with Amazon, Microsoft nearby.

Tempe, AZ.notes: Affordable desert city with growing tech scene.

Palo Alto, CA.notes: Very expensive Silicon Valley location, top university.

Boston, MA.notes: Very expensive but world-class education and network.
